avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The remaining patchy spring snow will be well bonded and stable. The snow surface will become firm overnight, softening where exposed to the sun. Greatest areas will remain in gullies and around coire rims on North to East aspects above 1100 metres, very little if any snow elsewhere. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO for 6/4. Remaining patchy snow well bonded and stable. Low hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: High pressure will bring another fine sunny day with light South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be above the summits.
Observed Weather Influences: A fine sunny day with light Easterly winds. The freezing level is above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: The remaining patchy spring snow is well bonded and stable. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: GC6/4 Dry cool pm bec mild through day, snow patches firm possible icy but softening in sun giving shallow surface instabilities.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Continuing dry and clear, sunny through the day. Cool with frost possible overnight. Daytime winds will be moderate generally South-Easterly. Summit temperatures initially will be around 0.5 degrees Celsius rising to 5 degrees Celsius through the course of the day.
Observed Weather Influences: Another dry and sunny day, feeling cool in the moderate to fresh Easterly winds. Cool conditions affected the area overnight, the freezing level climbed above the summits throughout the morning.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC for 6/4. Insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard report.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Remaining dry and sunny. Light South-South-Easterly winds, veering Southerly and increasing to Moderate during the morning. Overnight frost with air temperature rising during the day. Freezing level above the summits.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry and sunny day with light East-North-Easterly winds. Freezing level above the summits. Remaining cool in shady locations.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: TO for 6.4: No avalanche hazard.  For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Dry conditions will continue with clear skies overnight and sunshine during the day.  Fresh Easterly winds will ease to become light and variable during the day.
Observed Weather Influences: A sunny day with fresh Easterly winds. The freezing level remained above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 6/4. Another warm sunny day with a very limited snowpack. There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard report

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Another dry and sunny day. The freezing level will remain above the summits.
Observed Weather Influences: A warm day with almost unbroken sunshine during the day. After a slight overnight frost the freezing level rose above the summits.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
avalancheActivity.highlights: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published unless conditions change.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Mild, dry and clear with an overnight frost. Sunny and mild during the day but it will remain cooler where heavily shaded.
Observed Weather Influences: Dry with an overnight frost. Warmer on sun exposed locations but it remained much cooler on heavily shaded aspects.
ObservedSnowStability: Snowpack is limited to receding small high altitude snow patches mainly on North to East aspects, a few as low as 850m. Good stability in all locations. Residual very small cornices remain over a few selected steep crags above 1000m. The avalanche hazard is Low.
